parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post is from a politician, Mircea Cirt, it does not explicitly mention any parliamentary candidate by name or party affiliation. The post focuses on general political themes related to national security and strategic errors, without endorsing or opposing specific candidates in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended for a broad audience, not a specific individual or small group. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a wide dissemination.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post seems to be to express Mircea Cirt's views on national security and political leadership, rather than directly influencing votes for or against any particular candidate in the parliamentary elections.  The post uses general terms and does not explicitly call for support or opposition to any specific candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents an opinion piece on a political issue. While it's not strictly journalistic in the traditional sense, it could be considered a form of citizen journalism, expressing a political opinion. However, the lack of factual evidence and the promotional nature of the paid post blur the lines.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>True. The post can be interpreted as expressing Mircea Cirt's personal opinion on the need for strong leadership and effective policies regarding national security. While it touches upon political issues, it does not explicitly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1139688567574885</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while from a politician and paid for as an advertisement, does not appear to violate Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections.  It focuses on broader political themes related to national security and leadership, expressing an opinion rather than directly influencing the vote.  The lack of explicit calls to action or endorsements of specific candidates weakens the argument for it being electoral propaganda. While the post is from a politician, this alone does not constitute electoral propaganda if it does not directly promote or oppose a candidate in the election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
